Frequently Asked Questions

Are you insured & licensed to do this work?
Yes in every aspect. Our trucks and drivers are fully insured to do this work, including full liability cover for up to six and a half million. We are licensed by the National Waste Collection Permit Office. Please see the www.nwcpo.ie site in our links option to search our license status.
Why use your service instead of a skip or skip bag?
We do all the work; from top story apartments to townhouses we’ll take any quantity of junk or trash away and our charges reflect only the volume of junk we remove. With skip hire you have to pay for the entire volume of the skip, regardless of how much you fill. There is also the added hassle and expense of having to apply for a skip hire permit in some cases and the fact that you have to do all the loading and clearing up yourself. With our service all you have to do is make a call.
What type of things do you take away?
We will remove pretty much anything, for example all types of Furniture & furnishings like carpets, flooring and bathrooms. Appliances like washers & dryers, Electricals like computers, printers & TV’s etc. Garage & Garden refuse junk like wooden sheds, branches, grass, leaves, tools, lawn mowers. DIY debris like plaster, pallets, glass, timber & tiles.
What type of things do you not take away?
Please see our list of restrictions & prohibited items on the Price Guide page. Certain items are technically classified as hazardous such as fridge freezers, paint cans & asbestos. Also don’t forget we are a Junk Removal service so we are not licensed to remove domestic household waste i.e. what goes into your black bin.
Why can't you take hazardous waste?
We are not licensed to remove hazardous waste. There are companies however that you can contact to collect such waste, please see our links option, which will include a link to your local county council. They will have information on what to do with hazardous waste that can be helpful.
How do you charge?
In general we charge by volume or in other words only by the amount of junk removed, measured in cubic yards: one cubic yard is about the same size as a standard washing machine, about 3 ft x 3 ft x 3 ft.
Why can't you give me an exact price over the phone?
Our rates are based on the amount and type of junk being removed. Until we see what is to be removed, we can't give you an exact price. Once at the premises but before starting a job, our team will quickly review the materials to be removed and provide you with an obligation free quote of how much the job will cost.
Can you do the job outside ordinary business hours?
Normally yes, let us know and we will try our best to accommodate your requirements.
How clean and efficient are your workers?
Our workers are very conscious of cleanliness and respect for your property. To minimise the chance of dirtying the inside of your property, we use dust sheets and plastic shoe covers when required to avoid traipsing mud around the house or work area.
What do you do with the junk?
The majority is recycled or reused - by being given to charities or taken to specialist recycling facilities.
Where are you based?
We are primarily based in Dublin, Ireland but we have future plans to expand to surrounding counties.
Why use your service instead of a skip?
We do all the work; from top story apartments to townhouses we’ll take any quantity of junk or trash away and our charges reflect only the volume of junk we remove. With skip hire you have to pay for the entire volume of the skip, regardless of how much you fill. There is also the added hassle and expense of having to apply for a skip hire permit in some cases and the fact that you have to do all the loading and clearing up yourself. With our service all you have to do is make a call.

We use cookies to ensure that we give you the best experience on our website. Find out more here.

Cookies

Our Site uses cookies to improve our site and enhance your experience. This policy explains how we do that.

What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small files that are stored on your computer. They hold a small amount of data, specific to your computer and the website you are on, and can be read by the web server or the client computer.
You may be able to configure your web browser to prevent the use of cookies although some functions or services may not be available.
For more information on the use of cookies and how to disable them, we recommend www.allaboutcookies.org. A cookie is a text file containing a small amount of data which is downloaded to the device you use to access our Site and stored on your device’s hard drive. These cookies are for various purposes, including to let our Site recognise your device when you visit the Site again, ensure that you are sent the correct content and to store information about your preferences or services provided for you.
Web beacons or other similar files can also do the same thing. We use the term “cookies” in this policy to refer to all files that collect information in this manner.

How Do We Use Cookies?

We use cookies to track the number of visitors to our website.
We use this information only to make your experience better and we never pass on information to anybody else.
We never receive any personal data or exchange any data with any 3rd parties.
If you are not happy with this, please disable your cookies in your browser settings.
